item.title: By: Staarkhand
item.dc:creator: Staarkhand
item.description: DAoC killspam owned. I loved hearing parties or raids wipe in DF, and PvP killspam probably motivated 75% of the PvP in that game.
item.content:encoded: DAoC killspam owned. I loved hearing parties or raids wipe in DF, and PvP killspam probably motivated 75% of the PvP in that game.

item.title: By: Anon
item.dc:creator: Anon
item.description: Might be switching to Guild Wars too - the latest patch's Error #132 is preventing me from playing, and Blizzard's support tells me to drop by their FTP and download the repair.zip . . . but the FTP is full. That and the mirrors are full too. /sigh
item.content:encoded: Might be switching to Guild Wars too – the latest patch’s Error #132 is preventing me from playing, and Blizzard’s support tells me to drop by their FTP and download the repair.zip . . . but the FTP is full. That and the mirrors are full too. /sigh

item.title: By: Aufero
item.dc:creator: Aufero
item.description:
<i>Some of the players act as if learning to play a particular character in a game takes longer than all of about five minutes.</i>
The sad part is that you're right - it doesn't take more than five minutes, and yet I constantly end up grouping with people who were stoned or something during that five minutes.
item.content:encoded:
Some of the players act as if learning to play a particular character in a game takes longer than all of about five minutes.

The sad part is that you’re right – it doesn’t take more than five minutes, and yet I constantly end up grouping with people who were stoned or something during that five minutes.

item.title: By: Abalieno
item.dc:creator: Abalieno
item.description: Hahah, the players defined as "drivers" makes me laugh in a silly way.
item.content:encoded: Hahah, the players defined as “drivers” makes me laugh in a silly way.
